title: Child care licensing records 2019-present

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
•	Provider name or ID
•	Provider address or geocode
•	Latest license issue date and expiration date

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

title: NYPD September

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYPD September
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The New York City police department piloted unmanned aircrafts in response to complaints about large gatherings, including private events, over Labor Day weekend in 2023. I am seeking: 

1. Drone flight videos created by the NYPD from Thursday August 31st 2023 to Tuesday September 5 2023.  
2. Underlying incident or investigatory reports created in response to a call for service where a drone was dispatched that weekend. 
3. Flight logs for all drone flights dispatched that weekend. If KML files or geospatial data exist, please include that as well.
4. Reprimands relating to drones, including misuse of equipment and failure to properly maintain equipment since 2016

In some circumstances, some portions of drone videos might implicate the investigatory records exemption, or privacy interests might  justify withholding certain portions of drone videos under the law. However, the agency must should still disclose any reasonably segregable portion of a record that is subject to disclosure after deletion of the portions that are exempted by law.   By analogy, when disclosing a video recording of a “critical incident, agencies can and do use redaction technology, including blurring or distorting images or audio, to obscure those specific portions of the recording” that implicate the reasonable expectation of privacy of a subject depicted in the recording.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Policies and Specific Actions Regarding Identification and Reporting of Individuals by State Forest Rangers (New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Policies and Specific Actions Regarding Identification and Reporting of Individuals by State Forest Rangers (New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any and all policies, guidelines, or protocols that govern the actions of state forest rangers when encountering individuals in state parks, including criteria or indicators used to identify someone as a suspect or fugitive.

2. Information on the extent of authority that state forest rangers have in checking the identity of individuals they encounter.

3. The specific circumstances under which state forest rangers are authorized to contact other law enforcement agencies.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #W020119-090323
communications.communication:
Subject: Request for Expedited Processing of FOIL Request #W020119-090323 Due to State Disaster Emergency

Dear Danielle Gillespie, City Clerk / Records Access Officer,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to request expedited processing of my FOIL request (Tracking #W020119-090323) submitted on September 3, 2023, regarding the incident on the 400 block of South Pearl Street on September 1, 2023.

Given the ongoing state disaster emergency declared by Governor Kathy Hochul concerning gun violence (Executive Order No. 3.20), the information sought in my FOIL request is of significant public interest and concern. The Governor's emergency declaration underscores the urgency and importance of transparency in matters related to gun violence.

I kindly request that the processing of my FOIL request be expedited and that a rolling release of records be implemented, given the public safety implications.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

title: Texas HB 1181 (Office of the Lieutenant Governor of Texas)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas HB 1181 (Office of the Lieutenant Governor of Texas)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports state that Texas passed HB 1181.

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the legal basis and enforcement of HB 1181. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed the legislation, B) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of how the legislation works or will be enforced, and C) any other document that has been used to help explain the legislation, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) A copy of any privacy impact assessments, use policies, standard operating procedures, data retention policies, legal opinions or analysis, warranties, non-disclosure agreements, contracts, liability waivers, insurance agreements, Requests for Proposals, Responses to Requests for Proposal, Memorandums of Understanding, Letters of Interest, regarding the legislation.

3) Any digital communications including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) that mention HB 1181, online porn, sex trafficking, pornhub, or age verification.

4) Any law enforcement records relating to the enforcement of HB 1181, including case and arrest records.

5) Any proposals, contracts, or other documentation relating to acceptable age verification software

6) Any emails, presentations, or other communications with employees of Mindgeek (@mindgeek.com) and/or PornHub (@pornhub.com)

Please search for documents created or shared between January 1, 2022 and the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. It will be used in the course of reporting for journalistic purposes.

Sincerely,
Samantha Cole

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Cole
